content:
• Wednesday, July 10, 2013

  • Japanese stocks open lower as the Nikkei drops 0.6% in early trading. Meanwhile, Australian and...

    Japanese stocks open lower as the Nikkei drops 0.6% in early trading. Meanwhile, Australian and South Korean shares rise 0.62% and 1.42% respectively. The dollar is 0.2% weaker against the yen to ¥99.45 at last check.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:39 PM
  • BPI

    Bridgepoint Education (NYSE:BPI) soars 26% AH as Ashford University gets initial accreditation...

    Bridgepoint Education (NYSE:BPI) soars 26% AH as Ashford University gets initial accreditation from WASC whose visiting team noted that the institution "has been fundamentally transformed and [the] culture has … shift[ed] from a market driven approach to an institution committed to student retention and success." BPI also says it has "made operating cost reductions" which should eventually result in "annualized labor and operational cost savings" of ~$85M. Finally, BPI sees Q2 EPS of $0.16-0.20 on revenue of $195.5M-199.5M including a $6.2M severance related charge. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:34 PM
  • PENN

    Penn National Gaming (NASDAQ:PENN) says the Nevada Gaming Control Board has unanimously approved...

    Penn National Gaming (NASDAQ:PENN) says the Nevada Gaming Control Board has unanimously approved the steps necessary to implement the separation of its operating assets and real property assets. In order to complete the regulatory process in Nevada, the company now needs to obtain the approval of the Nevada Gaming Commission, which is scheduled to consider the matter on July 25.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 PM
  • CHFS

    Sunshine Heart (SSH) gains on a late-day coverage initiation by Oppenheimer with an...

    Sunshine Heart (SSH) gains on a late-day coverage initiation by Oppenheimer with an Outperformrating and a price target of $11. Shares +3.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • MACK

    Merrimack Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MACK) slips in the post session after announcing concurrent...

    Merrimack Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:MACK) slips in the post session after announcing concurrent offerings of $50M in common stock and $75M in convertible senior notes due 2020, plus an option to purchase up to an additional $7.5M in stock and $11.25M in principal amount of the notes to cover over allotments. JPMorgan and BAML are acting as joint book-runners. Shares -10.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:26 PM
  • RMTI

    Rockwell Medical (NASDAQ:RMTI) gets hit in post-session trading after the company announced it...

    Rockwell Medical (NASDAQ:RMTI) gets hit in post-session trading after the company announced it will hold a conference call tomorrow, Thursday, July 11, at 8:00am EDT to review top-line results from its Phase 3 study of SFP, its late-stage investigational drug for the treatment of iron deficiency in chronic kidney disease patients receiving hemodialysis. Rockwell plans to announce top-line results tomorrow morning prior to the call. Listen to the call here: RMTI Webcast. Shares -12.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:09 PM
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) increases the price of its previously announced tender offer from...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC) increases the price of its previously announced tender offer from $10.00 per share to $11.00 per share. On June 13, its Board of Directors approved the repurchase of up to $100M of outstanding stock, including the cash repurchase of up to $75M of common stock by way of a fixed-price issuer tender offer. Shares +1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:43 PM | 6 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) +1.8% AH after surging 16% during regular trading, as other rare earth...

    Molycorp (MCP) +1.8% AH after surging 16% during regular trading, as other rare earth (NYSEARCA:REMX) names also rose today: REE +11.7%, AVL +15.2%. A Euro Pacific analyst ties the move to reports from China that say the price increase in rare earth relates to a government campaign to shut down unlicensed mines in China's Ganzhau; funds may be buying a basket of related companies. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • VOXX

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PSLV +12%. VOXX +5%. APOL +4%. FIO +4%. VGM +3%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: PSLV +12%. VOXX +5%. APOL +4%. FIO +4%. VGM +3%.
    After-hours top losers: MACK -10%. EGAS -5%. RMTI -5%. SSYS -4%. PSMT -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) soared 16% on the day on no news, but the move may have been driven by a...

    Molycorp (MCP) soared 16% on the day on no news, but the move may have been driven by a technical breakout. Shares broke out from their 50-day MA at $6.09 on heavy volume and kept climbing; MCP has surged 24% this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:59 PM | 8 Comments
  • VOXX

    VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX): Q1 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $193M beats by...

    VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX): Q1 EPS of $0.09 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $193M beats by $1.03M. Shares +4.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • YUM

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM): FQ2 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.9B misses by $0.03B....

    Yum Brands (NYSE:YUM): FQ2 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.9B misses by $0.03B. Shares +2.72% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 2 Comments
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) -3.4% AH after reporting same-store sales rose 1% Y/Y in the 5-week period...

    Zumiez (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) -3.4% AH after reporting same-store sales rose 1% Y/Y in the 5-week period ending July 6, and that total sales rose 14.5%. The action sports apparel retailer posted 1.1% same-store growth, and 16.7% total growth, for the 4-week period ending June 1. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • XONE

    ExOne (XONE -3.8%) closes lower after SA contributor CDM Capital suggests the 3D printer maker...

    ExOne (XONE -3.8%) closes lower after SA contributor CDM Capital suggests the 3D printer maker is a worthwhile tactical short. Among the author's reasons: shares trade at 25x sales (roughly 2x the multiples given to 3D Systems and Stratasys), and the company's IPO lockup expiration (set for Aug. 6) will result in 7.1M more shares being available for sale. 32.5% of ExOne's float was already shorted as of June 14.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • AOBC

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC +0.8%) gets whipsawed on heavy volume in afternoon trading on reports...

    Smith & Wesson (SWHC +0.8%) gets whipsawed on heavy volume in afternoon trading on reports of a $230M contract win from the U.S. Army that appears to be erroneous. An SWHC company spokesperson says that the contract award was for Smith & Wesson Security Solutions, which is a separate, stand-alone company.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • ET

    Energy Transfer Equity (ETE +3.2%) reaches new 52-week highs in the wake of the upsized 7.5M...

    Energy Transfer Equity (ETE +3.2%) reaches new 52-week highs in the wake of the upsized 7.5M unit offering of AmeriGas Partners. ETE's target price is raised to $70 from $64 at Deutsche Bank.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • OA

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK +1.1%) gains on an upgrade to Sector Perform from Underperform by RBC...

    Alliant Techsystems (ATK +1.1%) gains on an upgrade to Sector Perform from Underperform by RBC Capital. The firm also raised its price target to $98 from $71. It's a gutsy call at this level, considering the stock has been a work horse since July of last year, virtually doubling on a steady trajectory higher without so much as a glance back.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:29 PM
  • AG

    First Majestic Silver (AG +3.3%) is tabbed with a Buy rating and C$16 price target at BAML,...

    First Majestic Silver (AG +3.3%) is tabbed with a Buy rating and C$16 price target at BAML, which expects the ramp-up of the lower-cost Del Toro mine will play a key role in doubling silver production by 2015 and generating strong revenue growth and margin expansion. AG should trade at a significant premium given its superior growth profile and above average exposure to precious vs. base metals, the firm says. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:13 PM | 1 Comment
  • DHR

    Danaher (DHR +1.4%) gets an added lift from Morgan Stanley today, after the firm raised its...

    Danaher (DHR +1.4%) gets an added lift from Morgan Stanley today, after the firm raised its price target from $68 to $72 and reiterated an Overweight on the stock. Morgan says it likes what it picked up from the company's recent pre-release and PID investor day, and is encouraged by positive EPS momentum and further upside potential from DHR's redeployment of $8B - $10B surplus capital through 2014. William Blair also boosts Q2 expectations on the presentation as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • ALJ

    It's another rough day for the big refinery stocks, whose margins are getting squeezed in the...

    It's another rough day for the big refinery stocks, whose margins are getting squeezed in the collapse in WTI-Brent spreads. Alon USA Energy (ALJ -9.1%) is hit especially hard after Barclays warns of a possible downside surprise in its upcoming earnings. Also: ALDW -5.9%, CVI -5.4%, CVRR -5%, TSO -4.5%, HFC -3.6%, PSX -3.3%, WNR -2.6%, MPC -2.6%, NTI -2.5%, DK -2.5%, VLO -2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 4 Comments
  • GTXI

    GTX (GTXI -12.7%) drops on a negative article from The Street's Adam Feuerstein, saying that...

    GTX (GTXI -12.7%) drops on a negative article from The Street's Adam Feuerstein, saying that Phase 3 studies of Enobosarm, its cancer-related muscle wasting drug, will fail. Feuerstein says that prior data shows that the treatment may be struggling to demonstrate both an increase muscle mass and improve muscle performance or function- which the FDA requires for approval.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM
  • MU

    Micron (MU -4.5%) is down 11% over the last two days in the absence of major news. Concerns...

    Micron (MU -4.5%) is down 11% over the last two days in the absence of major news. Concerns about PC weakness and slowing smartphone growth could be worrying investors, leading some to take profits following a 126% YTD gain (going into Tuesday). SA contributor Russ Fischer is defending Micron today: he notes pricing for 2Gb and 4Gb DRAM chips remains at parity on a $/Gb basis. This type of event only happens at times of supply constraints, given higher-density chips are more cost-efficient to produce.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 5 Comments
  • VEOEY

    Veolia Environment (VE +4.3%) spikes after Goldman upgrades the shares to Buy from Neutral...

    Veolia Environment (VE +4.3%) spikes after Goldman upgrades the shares to Buy from Neutral citing expectations of a "48% 2013-15 EPS compound annual growth rate" which analyst Dario Carradori notes only assumes "the company achieves 50% of its cost cutting target." Ultimately, VE's "significant restructuring potential" makes for "an attractive risk/ reward profile."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • MLCO

    Melco Crown (MPEL +2.2%) trades higher with positive comments from Australian tycoon James...

    Melco Crown (MPEL +2.2%) trades higher with positive comments from Australian tycoon James Packer on the prospects of the casino operator's Philippines project tipping sentiment. With government approval in its back pocket, the sky is the limit in the Philippines, according to Packer. The simple math: "There is 100 million people in The Philippines, 20 million people in Manila. And it is growing fast."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • ZBH

    Zimmer Holdings (ZMH +1%) gains today after saying that it's begun distributing its APEX Spine...

    Zimmer Holdings (ZMH +1%) gains today after saying that it's begun distributing its APEX Spine System, a set of implants and instruments designed to correct a broad range of spinal deformities as well as complex and degenerative spinal diseases. Under the terms of a long-term agreement with SpineCraft, Zimmer Spine will exclusively market the APEX Spine System to healthcare organizations across the U.S., Canada, Australia and New Zealand.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P -7.1%) slumps for the second day in a row after releasing disappointing June audience...

    Pandora (P -7.1%) slumps for the second day in a row after releasing disappointing June audience metrics. A column from The Verge's Greg Sandoval discussing the PR struggles the Internet radio giant is facing in its efforts to lower royalties might also be contributing to the drop. Among other things, Sandoval observes the Internet Radio Fairness Act failed to draw much Congressional support, and that a Pandora petition asking artists to support its legislative efforts triggered a backlash. Shares -11% since Monday's close, but still +99% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM | 4 Comments
  • NBR

    Nabors Industries' (NBR -5.8%) downbeat Q2 forecast could spell trouble for other oilfield...

    Nabors Industries' (NBR -5.8%) downbeat Q2 forecast could spell trouble for other oilfield services firms (NYSEARCA:OIH), Tudor Pickering warns; while some NBR-specific factors likely are at play, the U.S. horizontal rig count continues flat even with more than half the year over. NBR's biggest peers - SLB, HAL, BHI - are little changed, but smaller ones are mostly lower: HP -1.4%, PTEN -1.2%, PDS -1.5%, SPN -1.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • AETI

    American Electric Technologies (AETI +4.3%) hits a new 52-week high today after the company won...

    American Electric Technologies (AETI +4.3%) hits a new 52-week high today after the company won a contract to provide an electrical protection and controls solution for a new 65MW peaking power plant in Alberta, Canada. The name of the customer and terms of the contract were not disclosed, but AETI plans to ship the power distribution control systems in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:36 PM
  • CZR

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR +9.5%) pop after the company files an S-1 for its new...

    Shares of Caesars Entertainment (CZR +9.5%) pop after the company files an S-1 for its new investment vehicle which current shareholders will hold the rights to purchase.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • NPO

    EnPro Industries (NPO +4.7%) sets a new year high after the company announced late yesterday...

    EnPro Industries (NPO +4.7%) sets a new year high after the company announced late yesterday that claims against its Garlock Sealing Technologies unit in an asbestos liability trial may be half of previous estimates. The company says its expert puts the net present value of Garlock's expected legal liability for current and future mesothelioma claims at no more than $125M, or less than half of the $270M expected in November 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • CSIQ

    Solar stocks are turning in another good day (TAN +1.4%), aided by positive sell-side notes....

    Solar stocks are turning in another good day (TAN +1.4%), aided by positive sell-side notes. Goldman says conference talks point to "strong US demand across residential, commercial and utility channels, with solid visibility through the balance of 2013." The firm adds the talks suggest its forecasts for 30% and 19% U.S. installation growth in 2013 and 2014 could be conservative, and that pricing appears solid. Meanwhile, Nomura believes Canadian Solar (CSIQ +4%), lifted by recent project wins, is set to become the first Chinese solar firm to turn profitable in 2013. DQ +6.4%. LDK +3.7%. TSL +4.6%. JKS +5.1%. SPWR +4.4%. SCTY +2.3%. SUNE +3%. (CSIQ/Deloitte) (U.S. solar growth)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • BRLI

    More on William Blair's Bio-Reference (BRLI -8.8%) downgrade: A push for lower payment rates for...

    More on William Blair's Bio-Reference (BRLI -8.8%) downgrade: A push for lower payment rates for lab tests could disproportionately hurt BRLI due to its exposure to blood-based cancer tests — rates for lymphoma tests could rise 70% or more, analysts say. Also moving on the news is Quest Diagnostics (DGX +1.4%) which William Blair thinks will be the least affected, while shares of Neogenomics (NEO -15.4%) plummet on above average volume.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • NEON

    Midday top 10 gainers: NEON +25%. INO +22%. NUS +15%. SKBI +14%. PCYC +13%. VRML +13%. BMJ +13%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: NEON +25%. INO +22%. NUS +15%. SKBI +14%. PCYC +13%. VRML +13%. BMJ +13%. MCP +13%. ADHD +11%. SPEX +11%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: ADVS -25%. NEO -17%. PME -14%. XNY -11%. CREG -11%. ALJ -9%. TRR -8%. RAX -8%. BRLI -8%. LCNB -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • MJN

    Mead Johnson Nutrition (MJN +3.8%) finally caves-in to pressure and says it will reduce the...

    Mead Johnson Nutrition (MJN +3.8%) finally caves-in to pressure and says it will reduce the ex-factory price of its main products by 7% - 15% as of July 16. China's Bureau of Price Supervision and Anti-Monopoly recently launched an investigation into price-fixing in the infant formula market, prompting other firms such as Abbott Labs (NYSE:ABT), Nestle (OTCPK:NSRGY) and Danone to already reduce prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM
  • BRLI

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI -8.1%) slips on a downgrade to Market Perform from Outperform...

    Bio-Reference Laboratories (BRLI -8.1%) slips on a downgrade to Market Perform from Outperform at William Blair.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:16 PM
  • NUS

    Canaccord (Buy) hikes its price target on Nu Skin (NUS +13.2%) to $83 from $66 following upbeat...

    Canaccord (Buy) hikes its price target on Nu Skin (NUS +13.2%) to $83 from $66 following upbeat guidance. Analyst Scott Van Winkle says the company "is in the midst of a powerful product cycle, coupled with a concerted effort to improve margins that should drive above-average EPS growth." Similarly, Deutsche's Bill Schmitz Jr. raises his target to $80, noting that the company habitually issues conservative guidance meaning "it is possible that NUS beats and raises again before the end of the year."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • BB

    BlackBerry (BBRY -3.8%) slumps following the WSJ's report about additional layoffs, and another...

    BlackBerry (BBRY -3.8%) slumps following the WSJ's report about additional layoffs, and another bearish note from Pac Crest's James Faucette (previous). Faucette says checks indicate first-week U.K. sales of the mid-range Q5 may have only amounted to 10K-15K, well below the ~50K estimated for the Z10. U.K. carriers Orange and T-Mobile began taking Q5 pre-orders four weeks ago.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 24 Comments
  • ADTN

    Adtran (ADTN -3.1%) guides on its Q2 call (webcast) for mid-to-high single-digit Q/Q revenue...

    Adtran (ADTN -3.1%) guides on its Q2 call (webcast) for mid-to-high single-digit Q/Q revenue growth. That's above a consensus for roughly flat growth relative to Q2's $162.2M. However, the telecom equipment maker also expects its gross margin to drop thanks to new orders, which translates into a bigger mix of chassis sales relative to higher-margin line card sales. That's not going over well following a 30% YTD gain (going into today).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -3.2%) drop to a two-month low on heavy volume as...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (GMCR -3.2%) drop to a two-month low on heavy volume as chatter picks up that a "famous" investor took a short position in the stock. Though short interest has fallen dramatically on GMCR since peaking last fall, the battle between bears and bulls is still creating a lot of volatility (and opportunities) for traders.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • NBR

    Goldman Sachs removes Nabors Industries (NBR -5.2%) from its Conviction Buy list and drops its...

    Goldman Sachs removes Nabors Industries (NBR -5.2%) from its Conviction Buy list and drops its price target to $19.50 from $22, disappointed by NBR's downside guidance as it had felt confident in its forecast of $119M in EBIT. Goldman cuts its estimates for 2013 and 2014 EPS to $0.82 and $1.37 from $1.04 and $1.85, respectively; 2013-14 EBITDA was cut 5% and 9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:14 AM
  • CXW

    Corrections Corporation of America (CXW +3.2%) rallies after winning renewal of its contract...

    Corrections Corporation of America (CXW +3.2%) rallies after winning renewal of its contract with the CA Dept. of Corrections for another 3 years. The stock remains right around the level it was at a month ago when SA Pro's Jeffrey Dow Jones recommended it. Of course, there's the 5.8% yield as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • OHRP

    Thinly traded Ohr Pharmaceutical (OHRP -6%) is bouncing all over the board today, initially...

    Thinly traded Ohr Pharmaceutical (OHRP -6%) is bouncing all over the board today, initially popping +4% at the open, only to reverse course and move lower again as volume spikes appear to dominate the trading action. The company announced earlier this week that it's enrolled more patients in its ongoing Phase II clinical trial evaluating Squalamine Eye Drops for the treatment of the wet form of age-related macular degeneration. The study has now enrolled at least 60 patients at more than 20 clinical sites in the U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • ELX

    Emulex (ELX +2.5%) spikes higher after dealReporter reports the maker of server/storage adapter...

    Emulex (ELX +2.5%) spikes higher after dealReporter reports the maker of server/storage adapter cards and controller chips is expected to receive strong M&A interest, including possibly from legal adversary Broadcom (BRCM). Shares now +21% since Bloomberg reported last week Emulex has hired Goldman to find a suitor. (Starboard Value)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • BBY

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY -5.1%) wilt in early trading. Technical traders are saying the stock hit...

    Shares of Best Buy (BBY -5.1%) wilt in early trading. Technical traders are saying the stock hit technical resistance at $30 while the fundamental side points to cautious comments from analysts on the retailer.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • KYN

    Kayne Anderson MLP (KYN -4.5%) opens sharply lower after its upsized offering of 6.2M shares is...

    Kayne Anderson MLP (KYN -4.5%) opens sharply lower after its upsized offering of 6.2M shares is priced at $36/share, a 4.3% discount to Tuesday's close (earlier). At one point, shares were trading below $36, yet YTD gains are still ~22%. As of Feb. 28, KYN had 88.6M shares outstanding.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:59 AM
  • RAX

    Rackspace (RAX -3.3%) dives after Amazon Web Services (AMZN +0.2%) cuts EC2 cloud computing...

    Rackspace (RAX -3.3%) dives after Amazon Web Services (AMZN +0.2%) cuts EC2 cloud computing prices for dedicated instances (i.e. hardware dedicated to a single client) by up to 80%. Though AWS is known for cutting prices early and often, the size of this cut makes it noteworthy. Moreover, the fact it covers dedicated hardware suggests Amazon is taking aim not only at the cloud infrastructure services provided by the likes of Rackspace, Microsoft, and Google, but also the traditional hosting services offered  by Rackspace and others.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:57 AM | 3 Comments
  • MDRX

    Allscripts (MDRX +5%) expects Q2 bookings to have grown to over $200M from $194M a year ago, and...

    Allscripts (MDRX +5%) expects Q2 bookings to have grown to over $200M from $194M a year ago, and for its backlog to have climbed 13% Q/Q to $3.1B. "We are seeing a healthy mix of new agreements with existing clients as well as new client wins, growing our recurring revenue backlog as well as bookings," says Allscripts CEO Paul Black. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:52 AM
  • WLT

    Walter Energy (WLT +5.5%) is upgraded to Market Perform from Underperform at Raymond James,...

    Walter Energy (WLT +5.5%) is upgraded to Market Perform from Underperform at Raymond James, which believes WLT will be able to amend financial covenants on its credit facility. The firm also foresees the likely suspension of WLT's dividend to save cash, and reduced capex. Other firms have been upgrading shares recently, based on similar assumptions; WLT has jumped 14% already this week.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) +2.6% following an upgrade to Buy from Jefferies' Aaron Schwartz, who...

    Fortinet (NASDAQ:FTNT) +2.6% following an upgrade to Buy from Jefferies' Aaron Schwartz, who declares shares "have a 5:1 risk-reward to the upside ." Schwartz thinks security spend saw "a modest uptick" in Q2, with Fortinet gaining share, and that greater management oversight should "lead to improving sales consistency and a more balanced growth-reinvestment mix." Shares of the UTM security hardware vendor remain sharply below March levels; Q2 results are due on July 30. (Q1 warning)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM
  • END

    Endeavour International (NYSE:END) -2.6% premarket after saying its Scott platform in the U.K....

    Endeavour International (NYSE:END) -2.6% premarket after saying its Scott platform in the U.K. North Sea will begin a shutdown period on July 11 lasting 6-8 weeks to complete a planned work program. As a result, first production at the Rochelle field will be delayed until September.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM

  • Market preview: U.S. stock futures are little changed as investors shrug off some shockingly bad...

    Market preview: U.S. stock futures are little changed as investors shrug off some shockingly bad Chinese trade data and await the latest FOMC minutes and a speech from Ben Bernanke. The S&P Mini is flat. H-P rises 2.9% after an upgrade from Citigroup, while Family Dollar Stores gains 3% following earnings. Later: Wholesale Trade, EIA Petroleum Status
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZIOP

    Ziopharm Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP) rises 6.84% premarket. The company presented yesterday at the...

    Ziopharm Oncology (NASDAQ:ZIOP) rises 6.84% premarket. The company presented yesterday at the JMP Healthcare conference (full presentation).

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM
  • INO

    Premarket gainers: INO +19%. OTC:ASTI +21%. NUS +11%. MDRX +7%. CLF +6%. NEON +5%. PERI +6%.

    Premarket gainers: INO +19%. OTC:ASTI +21%. NUS +11%. MDRX +7%. CLF +6%. NEON +5%. PERI +6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • FREEF

    FreeSeas (FREE) announces it reached an agreement with lenders that will allow it to remove $30M...

    FreeSeas (FREE) announces it reached an agreement with lenders that will allow it to remove $30M of secured debt from its books. CEO Ion Varouxakis says the deal was struck after a prolonged period of "tortured uncertainty." FREE +66.5% premarket, but still well off levels from earlier this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • INO

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:INO) continues its surge of recent days, jumping 18.6% after...

    Inovio Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:INO) continues its surge of recent days, jumping 18.6% after saying that its Cellectra device for administering its Pennvax-B HIV vaccine improved the effectiveness of the drug in Phase I testing. Data published in the peer-reviewed Journal of Infectious Diseases showed that with the Cellectra, Pennvax significantly increased the number of responders producing robust and durable CD4 and CD8 T-cell responses, which are considered critical to fighting cancers and chronic infectious diseases.     A two-notch upgrade to Buy from Sell at Citi has shares of Hewlett-Packard (NYSE:HPQ) up 3% premarket. The Street may be "underestimating the financial benefits" of H2-loaded cost savings, the bank says, adding that EPS revisions are "now likely to start increasing in 2014 for the first time in nine quarters." Brean Capital's Ananda Baruah was out with an upgrade Tuesday, saying HPQ "can continue to move higher [on] strengthened cash flow, cost savings, and product mix."

    This just in - crude oil's in a bull market. Up 1.6%, WTI crude hits a new high for the move of...

    This just in - crude oil's in a bull market. Up 1.6%, WTI crude hits a new high for the move of $105.25/barrel - it's up 15% YTD and more than 30% from a year ago. Middle East rumblings may make a good excuse, but the run suggests some strength to global demand despite the curiously weak Chinese trade data overnight (which may just be a reversal of previous curiously weak data). Could the rising price put a dent in the Fed's projections of economic strength? USO +0.5% premarket.

    Chinese (FXI) and Hong Kong (EWH) shares lead the charge in Asia, rising 2.2% and 1.1% respectively after trade data that's so bad it must be good, because surely - so the theory goes - it will prompt China's leaders to forget all those flighty notions about re-balancing and pump lots of good old fashioned liquidity into the economy to keep growth ticking along nicely, irrespective of how unsustainable that may be. Japanese investors (DXJ) don't buy it and the Nikkei drops 0.4%. India -0.05%.
